title: Yves Peintures - TRIPLE FONT ID - serifs, san serif
content:
Looking for an ID on all three of these beauties: 'YVES', 'PEINTURES', and the sans serif used for '10 PLANCHES EN COULEURS'

Any help would be greatly appreciated!  
Danny

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150420030616im_/http:/typophile.com/files/tumblr_mor8wsWYh41qhtoslo1_500_6429.png)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [tumblr\_mor8wsWYh41qhtoslo1\_500.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20150420030616/http:/typophile.com/files/tumblr_mor8wsWYh41qhtoslo1_500.png) | 413.07 KB |
author: Danny_Miller

comments.content:
Since the publication dates from 1954, we are dealing with metal type here (phototypesetting was just beginning to take off in that year).

|YVES| appears to be Sorbonne Medium:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/berthold/sorbonne-bq/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150420030616/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/berthold/sorbonne-bq/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/berthold/sorbonne-bq/")

|PEINTURES| is a variation on Didot, but I haven’t located a spot-on match. Didot Headline Bold may work:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/didot-headline/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150420030616/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/didot-headline/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/didot-headline/")

|10 PLANCHES EN COULEURS| could be recreated using something like Titano B:  
 [http://www.studiodilena.com/it/titano.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150420030616/http:/www.studiodilena.com/it/titano.html "http://www.studiodilena.com/it/titano.html")
i'm amazed. thank you so much!
